thread.title: Khaidi No.150 box office collection day 5: Chiranjeevi’s comeback film hits the bullseye, crosses the Rs 100 crore mark in 5 days
thread.title_full: Khaidi No.150 box office collection day 5: Chiranjeevi’s comeback film hits the bullseye, crosses the Rs 100 crore mark in 5 days

author: karthika raveendran
title: Khaidi No.150 box office collection day 5: Chiranjeevi’s comeback film hits the bullseye, crosses the Rs 100 crore mark in 5 days
text:
On Chiranjeevi’s 61st birthday, let’s take a look at 8 of his masterpieces we can’t thank him enough for! 
Chiranjeevi ‘s comeback movie is creating waves at the box office alright. After getting off to a brilliant start in Andhra and Telugu states and overseas, the movie now has collected Rs 100 crore gross worldwide in 5 days! That’s right. Boss is not only back but is also here to stay! Ever since its released on January 10th, the movie has been creating records, On day 1 itself the movie collected Rs 47 crore ( gross) worldwide. Khaidi No. 150 boasts of the third highest opening after Kabali and Bahaubali. In fact its opening day collection in India beat Aamir Khan’s Dangal as well. The movie is performing phenomenally overseas as well. It has gone on to collect Rs 13 crore approx. Taran Adarsh also reported that Telugu films were dominating the US market last weekend – Telugu films are dominating the US market… Have eclipsed *all* Hindi films *this week*, including recent films and new ones…Khaidi no 150 has clearly beat Nandamuri’s 100th film – Gautamiputra Satakarni in the box office race. Well, looks like what the fans had predicted ( in the Bollwyoodlife poll) has turned out true after all. Also Read: Shocking! Chiranjeevi’s Khaidi No.150’s day 1 collection BEATS Aamir Khan’s Dangal 
Ram Charan, his son who debuted as producer with this movie is elated over the response,”What better way to foray into production than with ‘Khaidi No 150’. The film is truly close to my heart because it is my father’s 150th film. The kind of love the audiences have shown the film is overwhelming and humbling,” Looks like the father-son duo is turning out to be a winning combo! Also, this will be Kajal Aggarwal’s first hit in a long time. 2017 has indeed begun with a bang. 
Chiranjeevi’s 150th film – Khaidi no 150 is the Telugu remake of the Tamil movie Kaththi. It starred the megastar in a double role. He also shared screen space opposite Kajal Aggarwal for the first time. The project was helmed by VV Vinayak. This film marked the comeback of the Telugu star to the big screen after a decade.
